key_points: Production of the movie 'Knight' is ongoing in downtown Las Cruces, with scenes including a bank heist.
'Knight' is about a seasoned cop foiling a robbery and saving his daughter.
Ed Drake, who has collaborated with Bruce Willis on previous projects, directs 'Knight'.
The New Mexico Film Office announced 'Knight' filming from late October through early November.
Filming in New Mexico was chosen for its crew, talent, and tax credit benefits.
Street closures and simulated gunfire/explosions were part of the production.
Rumors suggest Bruce Willis may star in 'Knight', but he was not confirmed on set.
The production will employ around 50 local crew members, 10 principal actors, and 200 background talents from New Mexico.
Las Cruces is favored for filming due to its locations, supportive film office, and film incentives.
Three productions are scheduled to film in the Las Cruces area this fall and winter.
spokespersons: Amber Dodson (Director, New Mexico Film Office)
